emotional_core: GIVING from the heart - the joy and pride of contributing something special to build something beautiful together.

cards.title_he: 驻指旨专指砖址转 转职旨专旨指
cards.emotional_hook_en: This week is about GIVING! When you give something special to help make something beautiful, it feels SO good inside!
cards.emotional_hook_he: 址砖指旨旨注址 注址 职转执指! 职旨砖侄址转指旨 止转值 址砖侄旨旨 职只指 址注植止专 址注植砖止转 址砖侄旨旨 指驻侄, 侄 址专职执旨砖 指旨 指旨职 止!
cards.symbol_description: Hands lifting up colorful gifts toward golden light. Treasures include: shiny gold, purple and blue fabric, red yarn. A heart shape formed by the arrangement. Warm, glowing feeling. Community silhouettes in the background, all contributing.
cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive features.
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines (2-3px equivalent).
- Contrast: High contrast between foreground and background.
- Complexity: Maximum 5-7 distinct visual elements per scene.

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

Colors:
- Main elements: Bold primary colors
- Background: Soft warm cream/tan gradient

=== RESTRICTIONS ===
NEVER depict God in any human or physical form.
Use only: Warm golden light rays from above.
No scary elements. All imagery warm and inviting.

=== CARD TYPE: ANCHOR (Full Bleed Parasha Introduction) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Hebrew Title: "驻指旨专指砖址转 转职旨专旨指"
English Title: "Parashat Terumah"
Emotional Hook: "This week is about GIVING! When you give something special to help make something beautiful, it feels SO good inside!"

=== CENTRAL SYMBOL ===
Multiple hands (4-6 hands, diverse skin tones from light to dark brown) lifting treasures upward toward golden light.

The treasures being lifted:
- Shiny gold coins/jewelry
- Purple fabric (rich grape purple)
- Blue yarn/cloth (sky blue)
- Red/crimson fabric

The hands arrange naturally to suggest a heart shape.
Warm golden light rays stream down from soft clouds above.
Faint silhouettes of community members in the background.

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. HEBREW TITLE (top 15%): "驻指旨专指砖址转 转职旨专旨指" in large, beautiful Hebrew lettering with nikud
2. ENGLISH TITLE (5%): "Parashat Terumah" in friendly font below Hebrew
3. CENTRAL SYMBOL (55%): Hands lifting colorful treasures toward golden light rays
4. EMOTIONAL HOOK (18%): "This week is about GIVING! When you give something special to help make something beautiful, it feels SO good inside!"
5. Small decorative hearts/sparkles around the edges

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #5c2d91 Royal Purple (8px width)
- Heart icon in top-left corner

=== MOOD ===
Warm, generous, communal, joyful. Children should feel: "Giving is wonderful! Everyone can help!"
cards.teacher_script: This is Parashat Terumah! Can you say "Terumah"? Terumah! It means a special gift that you give from your HEART. This week, the Jewish people are going to build something SO special - and everyone gets to help! When we give something to help others, it makes us feel really good inside. Put your hand on your heart - that's where the good feeling is!

Title Context: Parashat Terumah (驻指旨专指砖址转 转职旨专旨指)

3. ACTION CENTER: You MUST place all faces, main characters, and key details in the CENTER 45% of the vertical space.
4. BACKGROUND: The top and bottom edges should be sky, ground, or scenery that can be covered without losing the story.

- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines (2-3px equivalent).
- Coloring: Flat, vibrant colors with subtle shading.

cards.title_he: 址旨拽指旨砖指 职只侄侄转
cards.english_description: God asks Moses for help. "Tell the people to bring gifts from their hearts. We are going to build something special!"
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Put your hand on your heart - that's where giving comes from!
cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive eyes (20% of face).
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines (2-3px equivalent).
- Emotion: Big, clear facial expressions visible from across classroom.

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

=== RESTRICTIONS ===
NEVER depict God in any human or physical form.
Show divine presence ONLY as warm golden light rays from clouds above.

=== CARD TYPE: STORY (Key Moment #1) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Title: "A Special Request"
Hebrew Title: "址旨拽指旨砖指 职只侄侄转"
Sequence Badge: #1 in white circle with red border (top-right corner)
Hebrew Keyword: "值" (Heart) in red badge
Story Text: "God asks Moses for help. 'Tell the people to bring gifts from their hearts. We are going to build something special!'"
Roleplay: "Act it out: Put your hand on your heart - that's where giving comes from!"

=== CHARACTER: MOSES ===
Friendly middle-aged man with warm brown skin and kind, gentle eyes.
Short dark beard with some gray. Blue and cream robes.
HEAD COVERING (cloth wrap/turban) - ALWAYS INCLUDE.
Wooden shepherd's staff resting nearby.

Expression: INSPIRED - eyes bright with excitement, gentle smile, one hand placed on his heart. Looking upward toward the light. He has just heard something wonderful!

=== VISUAL DESCRIPTION ===
Moses stands in a desert/mountain setting (suggesting Sinai).
Warm golden light rays stream down from soft glowing clouds above.
Moses has one hand on his heart, looking up with an inspired, honored expression.
Simple background: desert hills, blue sky.

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. TITLE BAR (top 12%): Red background bar with:
   - Lightning bolt icon (left)
   - "A Special Request" in white text (center)
   - "址旨拽指旨砖指 职只侄侄转" below in white
   - #1 badge in white circle (right)
2. ACTION SCENE (center 55%):
   - Golden light rays from above (divine presence)
   - Moses center-frame, hand on heart, looking up
   - Inspired, excited expression
   - Desert/mountain background
3. HEBREW KEYWORD BADGE (floating at bottom of art): "值" with heart icon, "Heart" below, red background
4. TEXT BOX (bottom 25%): Cream/tan background containing:
   - "God asks Moses for help. 'Tell the people to bring gifts from their hearts. We are going to build something special!'"
   - Star icon followed by: "Act it out: Put your hand on your heart - that's where giving comes from!" in red accent text

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #FF4136 Red (8px width)

=== MOOD ===
Inspirational, honored, anticipatory. Moses feels special to be asked. Children should feel: "Something exciting is about to happen!"
cards.teacher_script: God said to Moses, "I have a very special job for the people. Ask them to bring gifts - but not just any gifts. Gifts from their HEARTS!" That means gifts they REALLY want to give. Put your hand on your heart. Can you feel it? When we give from our heart, it means we really, truly want to help! Moses was so excited to tell everyone!

cards.title_he: 址转指旨止转 指驻止转
cards.english_description: The people bring their treasures! Shiny gold! Sparkling silver! Beautiful purple, blue, and red fabric! Everyone has something to give!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Carry something precious very carefully and put it in the pile!
cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive eyes.
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines.
- This scene should be COLORFUL and JOYFUL!

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

=== CARD TYPE: STORY (Key Moment #2) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Title: "Beautiful Gifts"
Hebrew Title: "址转指旨止转 指驻止转"
Sequence Badge: #2 in white circle with red border (top-right corner)
Hebrew Keyword: "指指" (Gold) in red badge
Story Text: "The people bring their treasures! Shiny gold! Sparkling silver! Beautiful purple, blue, and red fabric! Everyone has something to give!"
Roleplay: "Act it out: Carry something precious very carefully and put it in the pile!"

=== CHARACTERS: ISRAELITE COMMUNITY ===
Diverse group of Jewish people - show 5-7 individuals:
- A father carrying something gold (coins, jewelry, cup)
- A mother holding beautiful purple fabric
- A child carrying blue yarn excitedly
- An elderly person with silver items
- Another child with red/crimson cloth

All have warm skin tones (variety from light to dark brown).
Modest, colorful clothing in earth tones.
ALL have joyful, proud expressions - big smiles!

=== VISUAL DESCRIPTION ===
A procession of people bringing their treasures.
The scene BURSTS with color:
- GOLD: shiny, gleaming gold items
- PURPLE: rich grape-purple fabric
- BLUE: sky-blue yarn and cloth
- CRIMSON: deep red fabric

People walk toward a central collection area.
A child in the foreground carries something with great care.
Warm sunlight. Festive, generous atmosphere.

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. TITLE BAR (top 12%): Red background bar with:
   - Lightning bolt icon (left)
   - "Beautiful Gifts" in white text (center)
   - "址转指旨止转 指驻止转" below in white
   - #2 badge in white circle (right)
2. ACTION SCENE (center 55%):
   - Colorful procession of people bringing gifts
   - Emphasis on the COLORS of the treasures
   - Joyful expressions on all faces
   - Child in foreground for relatability
3. HEBREW KEYWORD BADGE (floating at bottom of art): "指指" with sparkle icon, "Gold" below, red background
4. TEXT BOX (bottom 25%): Cream/tan background containing:
   - "The people bring their treasures! Shiny gold! Sparkling silver! Beautiful purple, blue, and red fabric! Everyone has something to give!"
   - Star icon followed by: "Act it out: Carry something precious very carefully and put it in the pile!" in red accent text

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #FF4136 Red (8px width)

=== MOOD ===
Joyful, generous, colorful, celebratory! Children should feel: "I want to bring something too!"
cards.teacher_script: When the people heard they could help, they were SO excited! They brought their most beautiful things. Some people brought shiny gold - ZAHAV! Some brought silver. Some brought beautiful fabric - purple like grapes, blue like the sky, red like apples! Let's pretend we're bringing something special. Pick up something pretend that's very precious. Carry it carefully... now put it gently in the pile. You're helping!

cards.english_description: Everyone works together! Some people sew. Some people hammer. Some people carry. When we all help, we can build amazing things!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Show me how YOU would help build - hammer, sew, carry, or paint!
cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive eyes.
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines.
- Show MOVEMENT and ACTIVITY!

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

=== CARD TYPE: STORY (Key Moment #3) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Title: "Building Together"
Hebrew Title: "旨止执 职旨址址"
Sequence Badge: #3 in white circle with red border (top-right corner)
Hebrew Keyword: "址址" (Together) in red badge
Story Text: "Everyone works together! Some people sew. Some people hammer. Some people carry. When we all help, we can build amazing things!"
Roleplay: "Act it out: Show me how YOU would help build - hammer, sew, carry, or paint!"

=== CHARACTERS: WORKING COMMUNITY ===
Show 5-6 people doing DIFFERENT building tasks:
- Someone SEWING beautiful fabric (pulling thread, focused)
- Someone HAMMERING wood (motion lines showing hammer movement)
- Two people CARRYING a wooden beam together
- Someone arranging/organizing materials
- A child helping by holding something or handing tools

Diverse group, all ages, warm skin tones.
Everyone looks happy while working - smiles, focused joy.

=== VISUAL DESCRIPTION ===
A busy, happy construction scene.
The beginnings of a structure visible (wooden frames, fabric panels).
Action and movement throughout:
- Motion lines on the hammer
- Thread being pulled through fabric
- People lifting together

Materials visible: gold items, colorful fabrics, wooden beams.
Warm outdoor setting, sunny day.

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. TITLE BAR (top 12%): Red background bar with:
   - Lightning bolt icon (left)
   - "Building Together" in white text (center)
   - "旨止执 职旨址址" below in white
   - #3 badge in white circle (right)
2. ACTION SCENE (center 55%):
   - Multiple people doing different tasks
   - Clear movement and activity
   - Child participating
   - Beginning of structure visible
3. HEBREW KEYWORD BADGE (floating at bottom of art): "址址" with hands icon, "Together" below, red background
4. TEXT BOX (bottom 25%): Cream/tan background containing:
   - "Everyone works together! Some people sew. Some people hammer. Some people carry. When we all help, we can build amazing things!"
   - Star icon followed by: "Act it out: Show me how YOU would help build - hammer, sew, carry, or paint!" in red accent text

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #FF4136 Red (8px width)

=== MOOD ===
Energetic, collaborative, purposeful, joyful work! Children should feel: "I want to help too! What job can I do?"
cards.teacher_script: Now it was time to BUILD! But one person couldn't do it alone. They needed to work YACHAD - together! Some people knew how to sew the beautiful fabrics. Some people knew how to hammer and build with wood. Some people carried heavy things. Everyone helped in their own special way! Let's all help build! Show me - what job would YOU do? Hammer? (pound pound!) Sew? (pull the thread!) Carry? (lift and walk!) Paint? (swish swish!) Great job, builders!

   - "Everyone works together! Some people sew. Some people hammer. Some people carry. When we all help, we can build amazing things!"
   - Star icon followed by: "Act it out: Show me how YOU would help build - hammer, sew, carry, or paint!" in red accent text

- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- 

=== MOOD ===
Energetic, collaborative, purposeful, joyful work! Children should feel: "I want to help too! What job can I do?"

cards.title_he: 执值旨 指 注指砖执旨!
cards.english_description: The Mishkan is beautiful! It shines with gold and glows with colors. Everyone helped make this special place!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Step back, look up, and say WOW together!
cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive eyes.
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines.
- This scene should feel MAJESTIC and AWE-INSPIRING!

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

=== RESTRICTIONS ===
Show the Mishkan (Tabernacle) as a beautiful tent structure.
It should look special but NOT show the inside or the Ark.
Warm golden glow around it - divine presence as LIGHT only.

=== CARD TYPE: STORY (Key Moment #4) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Title: "Look What We Made!"
Hebrew Title: "执值旨 指 注指砖执旨!"
Sequence Badge: #4 in white circle with red border (top-right corner)
Hebrew Keyword: "执砖职指旨" (Tabernacle) in red badge
Story Text: "The Mishkan is beautiful! It shines with gold and glows with colors. Everyone helped make this special place!"
Roleplay: "Act it out: Step back, look up, and say WOW together!"

=== VISUAL DESCRIPTION ===
The completed Mishkan stands magnificent:
- Beautiful tent structure with golden accents
- Colorful fabric panels (purple, blue, crimson)
- Wooden framework visible
- Warm golden light glowing around/from it

In the foreground: Community members (5-6 people including children) standing back and looking UP at their creation.
Poses of awe: hands on cheeks, pointing, embracing each other.
Expressions: amazed, proud, joyful tears, wonder.
A family (parent and child) in foreground - child pointing up excitedly.

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. TITLE BAR (top 12%): Red background bar with:
   - Lightning bolt icon (left)
   - "Look What We Made!" in white text (center)
   - "执值旨 指 注指砖执旨!" below in white
   - #4 badge in white circle (right)
2. ACTION SCENE (center 55%):
   - Mishkan in upper portion, glowing beautifully
   - Community in lower portion, looking up in awe
   - Family with child in foreground
   - Wonder and pride on all faces
3. HEBREW KEYWORD BADGE (floating at bottom of art): "执砖职指旨" with tent icon, "Tabernacle" below, red background
4. TEXT BOX (bottom 25%): Cream/tan background containing:
   - "The Mishkan is beautiful! It shines with gold and glows with colors. Everyone helped make this special place!"
   - Star icon followed by: "Act it out: Step back, look up, and say WOW together!" in red accent text

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #FF4136 Red (8px width)

=== MOOD ===
Awe, wonder, accomplishment, communal pride! Children should feel: "WOW! They did it! We can build amazing things together!"
cards.teacher_script: And when it was all done, everyone stepped back and looked. The Mishkan - God's special house - was SO beautiful! It sparkled with gold. The fabrics were purple and blue and red. Everything was just right. And you know what? EVERYONE helped make it. The people who brought gold, the people who brought fabric, the people who sewed, the people who hammered - everyone! Let's step back and look at our amazing work. Ready? Say it with me: WOW! We did it TOGETHER!

cards.torah_talk_instruction: Sit in a circle and share!
cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive eyes.
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines.
- Mood: Calm, thoughtful, inviting for discussion.

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

=== CARD TYPE: CONNECTION (Discussion Card) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Title: "What Can I Give?"
Hebrew Title: "指 植执 指止 指转值转?"
Feeling Faces Row (Hebrew labels ONLY on faces):
  ス 值旨侄 |  砖指值址 |  指执 |  执专职指旨砖
Question 1: "If we were building something special for our classroom, what would YOU bring to help?"
Question 2: "How do you think the people felt when they gave their special gifts?"
Question 3: "What's something special you have that you could share with someone?"
Bottom Banner: "Torah Talk: Sit in a circle and share!"

=== CHARACTERS ===
2-3 children (ages 4-6 appearance) in thoughtful, sharing poses:
- One child holding out an object to share (toy, book, or craft item)
- One child with hand on chin, thinking
- One child smiling, looking at the sharing child

Diverse children, warm and relatable.
Simple clothing, modern/timeless style.

=== VISUAL DESCRIPTION ===
Children in a circle-time type setting.
One child is offering/sharing something with a proud, generous expression.
Other children look thoughtful or appreciative.
Warm, soft background (classroom or home setting).

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. TITLE BAR (top 10%): Blue background bar with:
   - Thought bubble icon (left)
   - "What Can I Give?" in white text (center)
   - "指 植执 指止 指转值转?" below in white
2. SCENE (25%): Children in sharing/thinking poses
3. FEELING FACES ROW (10%): Four emoji-style faces with HEBREW labels only:
   ス 值旨侄 |  砖指值址 |  指执 |  执专职指旨砖
4. QUESTIONS (40%): Three colored speech bubbles:
   - Pink bubble: "If we were building something special for our classroom, what would YOU bring to help?"
   - Green bubble: "How do you think the people felt when they gave their special gifts?"
   - Yellow bubble: "What's something special you have that you could share with someone?"
5. BOTTOM BANNER (8%): Blue banner with "Torah Talk: Sit in a circle and share!" in white

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #0074D9 Blue (8px width)

=== MOOD ===
Warm, reflective, inviting. Children should feel safe to share.
cards.teacher_script: Let's sit in our Torah Talk circle! In our story, everyone brought something to help. Now I want to hear from YOU! If we were building something special for our classroom - maybe a cozy reading corner or a beautiful art wall - what would YOU bring to help? Maybe crayons? A special pillow? Your helping hands? Let's go around and share. And point to a feeling face - how does it feel when you give something special?

cards.torah_talk_instruction: Sit in a circle and share!
cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive eyes.
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines.
- Mood: Collaborative, warm, joyful.

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

=== CARD TYPE: CONNECTION (Discussion Card) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Title: "Helping Together"
Hebrew Title: "注止职专执 职旨址址"
Feeling Faces Row (Hebrew labels ONLY on faces):
   砖指值址 | ス 值旨侄 |  注止值专 |  指指拽
Question 1: "Have you ever helped build or make something with other people? What did you make?"
Question 2: "Why is it more fun to build something with friends than all alone?"
Question 3: "What's one way you can help at home or at school this week?"
Bottom Banner: "Torah Talk: Sit in a circle and share!"

=== CHARACTERS ===
2-3 children (ages 4-6 appearance) working TOGETHER on a project:
- Building with blocks
- Or making an art project together
- Or working on a puzzle

All contributing, all smiling.
Hands meeting in the middle of the activity.
Diverse children.

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. TITLE BAR (top 10%): Blue background bar with:
   - Thought bubble icon (left)
   - "Helping Together" in white text (center)
   - "注止职专执 职旨址址" below in white
2. SCENE (25%): Children collaborating on a project
3. FEELING FACES ROW (10%): Four emoji-style faces with HEBREW labels only:
    砖指值址 | ス 值旨侄 |  注止值专 |  指指拽
4. QUESTIONS (40%): Three colored speech bubbles:
   - Pink bubble: "Have you ever helped build or make something with other people? What did you make?"
   - Green bubble: "Why is it more fun to build something with friends than all alone?"
   - Yellow bubble: "What's one way you can help at home or at school this week?"
5. BOTTOM BANNER (8%): Blue banner with "Torah Talk: Sit in a circle and share!" in white

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #0074D9 Blue (8px width)

=== MOOD ===
Collaborative, joyful, connected.
cards.teacher_script: The Jewish people worked TOGETHER - yachad! Have you ever built something with other people? Maybe you built a tall tower with blocks with a friend. Or helped your family cook dinner. Or made an art project with your class. Tell us about it! What did you make? Who helped? And here's a question: why is it more fun to build with friends? Let's share our ideas!

cards.torah_quote_en: Tell the people to bring Me gifts - from everyone whose heart moves them.
cards.torah_quote_he: 职执拽职旨 执 转职旨专旨指 值值转 指旨 执砖 植砖侄专 执职旨侄旨旨 执旨止
cards.example_sentence_en: When you share your toys, that's a terumah - a gift from your heart!
cards.example_sentence_he: 职旨砖侄址转指旨 职砖址转值旨祝 侄转 址爪址旨注植爪旨注执 砖侄职旨指, 止 转职旨专旨指 - 址转指旨指 值址值旨!
cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive eyes.
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines.
- This card teaches a Hebrew word!

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

=== RESTRICTIONS ===
- NO transliteration on the card
- NO QR codes
- Keep fonts simple and consistent - avoid decorative script fonts
- Use ONE clear font for all text

=== CARD TYPE: POWER WORD (Full Bleed Hebrew Vocabulary) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Large Hebrew Word: "转职旨专旨指" (very large, with nikud, top of card)
English Meaning: "GIFT" (bold, below Hebrew)
Torah Quote (English only): "Tell the people to bring Me gifts - from everyone whose heart moves them."
Source: " Exodus 25:2"
Example: "When you share your toys, that's a terumah - a gift from your heart!"

=== VISUAL DESCRIPTION ===
A child lifting up a gift (wrapped present or special object) toward warm golden light from above.

The child has a proud, happy expression.
The gift seems to glow as it's lifted.
Motion lines or sparkles showing the "lifting up" action.
Diverse child, relatable.

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. HEBREW WORD (top 20%): "转职旨专旨指" in LARGE, beautiful Hebrew lettering with nikud
   - Clear, readable font (not decorative script)
   - Centered
2. ENGLISH MEANING (8%): "GIFT" in bold, friendly font
3. VISUAL (center 40%): Child lifting gift upward toward golden light
4. TORAH QUOTE (15%): 
   - "Tell the people to bring Me gifts - from everyone whose heart moves them."
   - " Exodus 25:2" below, smaller
5. EXAMPLE (12%): "When you share your toys, that's a terumah - a gift from your heart!"

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #2ECC40 Green (8px width)
- NO icon in corner

=== MOOD ===
Educational and inspiring. Learning Hebrew is discovering treasure!
cards.teacher_script: Our special Hebrew word today is TERUMAH! Can you say it? Te-ru-MAH! It means a gift - but not just any gift. A terumah is a gift you give because you WANT to, from your heart. The Torah says the people brought gifts "from everyone whose heart moved them." That means they felt the giving feeling inside! When you share something because you want to help, that's a terumah. Can you think of a terumah you gave? Let's say it again: Terumah!

- Use ONE clear font for all text

Large Hebrew Word: "转职旨专旨指" (very large, with nikud, top of card)
English Meaning: "GIFT" (bold, below Hebrew)
Torah Quote (English only): "Tell the people to bring Me gifts - from everyone whose heart moves them."
Source: " Exodus 25:2"
Example: "When you share your toys, that's a terumah - a gift from your heart!"

=== VISUAL DESCRIPTION ===
A child lifting up a gift (wrapped present or special object) toward warm golden light from above.

The child has a proud, happy expression.
The gift seems to glow as it's lifted.
Motion lines or sparkles showing the "lifting up" action.
Diverse child, relatable.

Layout (top to bottom):
1. HEBREW WORD (top 20%): "转职旨专旨指" in LARGE, beautiful Hebrew lettering with nikud
   - Clear, readable font (not decorative script)
   - Centered
2. ENGLISH MEANING (8%): "GIFT" in bold, friendly font
3. VISUAL (center 40%): Child lifting gift upward toward golden light
4. TORAH QUOTE (15%): 
   - "Tell the people to bring Me gifts - from everyone whose heart moves them."
   - " Exodus 25:2" below, smaller
5. EXAMPLE (12%): "When you share your toys, that's a terumah - a gift from your heart!"

- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- 
- NO icon in corner

=== MOOD ===
Educational and inspiring. Learning Hebrew is discovering treasure!
